segment.source: Audit Security Group Management (Windows 10)
segment.target: Audit Security Group Management (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit Security Group Management, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when specific security group management tasks are performed.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit Security Group Management, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when specific security group management tasks are performed.

segment.source: Audit Security Group Management
segment.target: Audit Security Group Management

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Audit Security Group Management determines whether the operating system generates audit events when specific security group management tasks are performed.
segment.target: Audit Security Group Management determines whether the operating system generates audit events when specific security group management tasks are performed.

segment.source: Event volume: Low.
segment.target: Event volume: Low.

segment.source: This subcategory allows you to audit events generated by changes to security groups such as the following:
segment.target: This subcategory allows you to audit events generated by changes to security groups such as the following:

segment.source: Security group is created, changed, or deleted.
segment.target: Security group is created, changed, or deleted.

segment.source: Member is added or removed from a security group.
segment.target: Member is added or removed from a security group.

segment.source: Group type is changed.
segment.target: Group type is changed.

segment.source: Computer Type
segment.target: Computer Type

segment.source: General Success
segment.target: General Success

segment.source: General Failure
segment.target: General Failure

segment.source: Stronger Success
segment.target: Stronger Success

segment.source: Stronger Failure
segment.target: Stronger Failure

segment.source: Comments
segment.target: Comments

segment.source: Domain Controller
segment.target: Domain Controller

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: We recommend Success auditing of security groups, to see new group creation events, changes and deletion of critical groups.
segment.target: We recommend Success auditing of security groups, to see new group creation events, changes and deletion of critical groups.

segment.source: Also you will get information about new members of security groups, when a member was removed from a group and when security group membership was enumerated.
segment.target: Also you will get information about new members of security groups, when a member was removed from a group and when security group membership was enumerated.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: Member Server
segment.target: Member Server

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: We recommend Success auditing of security groups, to see new group creation events, changes and deletion of critical groups.
segment.target: We recommend Success auditing of security groups, to see new group creation events, changes and deletion of critical groups.

segment.source: Also you will get information about new members of security groups, when a member was removed from a group and when security group membership was enumerated.
segment.target: Also you will get information about new members of security groups, when a member was removed from a group and when security group membership was enumerated.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: Workstation
segment.target: Workstation

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: We recommend Success auditing of security groups, to see new group creation events, changes and deletion of critical groups.
segment.target: We recommend Success auditing of security groups, to see new group creation events, changes and deletion of critical groups.

segment.source: Also you will get information about new members of security groups, when a member was removed from a group and when security group membership was enumerated.
segment.target: Also you will get information about new members of security groups, when a member was removed from a group and when security group membership was enumerated.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: Events List:
segment.target: Events List:

segment.source: 4731(S): A security-enabled local group was created.
segment.target: 4731(S): A security-enabled local group was created.

segment.source: 4732(S): A member was added to a security-enabled local group.
segment.target: 4732(S): A member was added to a security-enabled local group.

segment.source: 4733(S): A member was removed from a security-enabled local group.
segment.target: 4733(S): A member was removed from a security-enabled local group.

segment.source: 4734(S): A security-enabled local group was deleted.
segment.target: 4734(S): A security-enabled local group was deleted.

segment.source: 4735(S): A security-enabled local group was changed.
segment.target: 4735(S): A security-enabled local group was changed.

segment.source: 4764(S): A group’s type was changed.
segment.target: 4764(S): A group’s type was changed.

segment.source: 4799(S): A security-enabled local group membership was enumerated.
segment.target: 4799(S): A security-enabled local group membership was enumerated.

segment.source: 4727(S): A security-enabled global group was created.
segment.target: 4727(S): A security-enabled global group was created.

segment.source: See event “4731: A security-enabled local group was created.”
segment.target: See event “4731: A security-enabled local group was created.”

segment.source: Event 4727 is the same, but it is generated for a global security group instead of a local security group.
segment.target: Event 4727 is the same, but it is generated for a global security group instead of a local security group.

segment.source: All event fields, XML, and recommendations are the same.
segment.target: All event fields, XML, and recommendations are the same.

segment.source: The type of group is the only difference.
segment.target: The type of group is the only difference.

segment.source: Important: this event generates only for domain groups, so the Local sections in event 4731 do not apply.
segment.target: Important: this event generates only for domain groups, so the Local sections in event 4731 do not apply.

segment.source: 4737(S): A security-enabled global group was changed.
segment.target: 4737(S): A security-enabled global group was changed.

segment.target: See event “4735: A security-enabled local group was changed.”

segment.target: Event 4737 is the same, but it is generated for a global security group instead of a local security group.

segment.target: The type of group is the only difference.

segment.target: Important: this event generates only for domain groups, so the Local sections in event 4735 do not apply.
